data.title: South Sudan Population
data.meta_description: South Sudan Population, South Sudan Population in 2019, South Sudan Population Density, South Sudan Life Expectancy, South Sudan Fertility Rate, South Sudan Population by Religion, South Sudan Population Global Rank, South Sudan Population Growth Rate, South Sudan population projection graph, South Sudan Population projection by 2050
data.text:
Highlights of Analysis:

South Sudan Population is increasing

#N/A

South Sudan Life Expectancy is increasing

South Sudan Fertility Rate is decreasing

Every year South Sudan population is expected to increase by 363636 people. South Sudan contributes 0.23% of world's total population. Average Life Expectancy in South Sudan is 58.686 and is expected to Increase in upcoming next 50 years.Life Expectancy is below average when compared to global average (Currently Hong Kong Ranks 1st for Life Expectancy of 85 years). How the world population is changing is of great importance for humanity’s impact on the Earth’s natural environment, but it also gives reasons to hope for a good future. South Sudan owns 0.0041% of land i.e. 610952 Sq Kms of land and Ranks 43 when compared to other Global Countries Land area

#N/A #N/A #N/A #N/A #N/A #N/A

South Sudan Population, Density, Fertility Rate and Life Expectancy Overview South Sudan Population Analysis Year 2010 Year 2020 Year 2030 South Sudan Population (in million) 10.06 13.61 17.25 South Sudan Global Rank 83rd 76th 76th South Sudan Global Population Share 0.14% 0.17% 0.2% South Sudan Global Population Density South Sudan Global Population Density Rank South Sudan Average Life Expectancy 53.65 58.68 62.87 South Sudan Average Life Expectancy Global Rank 193rd 194th 191st South Sudan Fertility Rate 5.37 4.54 3.85 South Sudan Fertility Rate Global Rank 17th 20th 23rd

Note : Population Density means number of people staying per kilometer and Fertility rate means number of kids born per women

What is the Population trend of South Sudan ?

Every year South Sudan population is expected to increase by 363636 people.

South Sudan population overall trend is expected to be Decreasing for next 50 years and expected to be in Decreasing trend for next 100 years.

South Sudan will see more birth rate than death rate for next 100 years.

South Sudan Global Population Rank for next 50 years is expected to be in Range of 76th-69th.

What is the Population growth rate of South-Sudan ?

South Sudan population average growth rate for next 50 years is increasing at Rate of 1.9%.

Overall population growth rate of South Sudan is expected to be decreasing.

What percentage of worlds population lives in South Sudan ?

South Sudan contributes 0.23% of world's total population.

South-Sudan Average Life Expectancy

What is the Average Life Expectancy in South-Sudan ?

Average Life Expectancy in South Sudan is 58.686 and is expected to Increase in upcoming next 50 years.

Life Expectancy is below average when compared to global average (Currently Hong Kong Ranks 1st for Life Expectancy of 85 years).

South Sudan ranks 194th in terms of average life expectancy around the world.

Table : Past and Expected Average Life Expectancy (Age) (Source)

Year Average Life Expectancy Rank 2010 53.65 193rd 2020 58.68 194th 2030 62.87 191st 2040 66.13 189th 2050 68.54 187th 2060 70.43 187th 2070 71.99 186th 2080 73.4 185th 2090 74.75 184th 2100 0

South-Sudan Average Fertility Rate

What is the Average Fertility Rate of South-Sudan ?

In South Sudan, Women gives birth to 4.541 (average) children every year and this fertility rate is expected to be in decreasing trend.

South Sudan rank is in range of 20th-27th in term of average fertility rate around the world.

Table : Past and Expected Average Fertility Rate

Year Average Fertility Rate Rank 2010 5.37 17th 2020 4.54 20th 2030 3.85 23rd 2040 3.32 25th 2050 2.93 28th 2060 2.65 27th 2070 2.43 28th 2080 2.26 28th 2090 2.12 26th 2100 2.02 27th

Reference (Source) :

https://population.un.org/wpp/

https://population.un.org/wpp/DataSources/

https://www.wikipedia.org/

Historical population data on a sub-national level – including their administrative divisions and principal towns – is collected by Jan Lahmeyer and published at his website www.populstat.info.

The Minnesota Population Center publishes various high-quality datasets based on census data beginning in 1790. At the time of writing this source was online at www.pop.umn.edu/index.php. It focuses on North America and Europe.

The Data & Information Services Center (DISC) Archive at University of Wisconsin-Madison provides access to census data and population datasets (mostly for the Americas). At the time of writing this source was online at http://www.disc.wisc.edu.

The International Database published by the U.S. Census Bureau provides data for the time 1950-2100. At the time of writing this source was online at https://www.census.gov/data-tools/demo/idb/informationGateway.php.

The Atlas of the Biosphere publishes data on Population Density. At the time of writing this source was online at www.sage.wisc.edu/atlas/maps.
